text: Brian Theodore Tyler is an American composer, musician, conductor, arranger, and producer born on May 8, 1972 in Orange County, California, known for his movie and video game scores. He scored Eagle Eye, Iron Man 3, Avengers: Age of Ultron with Danny Elfman, Now You See Me, and among others. He also re- arranged the current fanfare of the Universal Pictures logo for its 100th anniversary that was originally composed by Jerry Goldsmith, which debuted with The Lorax (2012), the 2013â€“2016 Marvel Studios logo, which debuted with Thor: The Dark World (2013), as well as the NFL Sunday Countdown Theme for ESPN, the Formula One theme (also used in Formula 2 and Formula 3) and five installments of the Fast & Furious franchise. For his work as a movie composer, he has won the IFMCA Awards 2014 Composer of the Year. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1972 births Category:American atheists Category:American conductors Category:American movie score composers Category:People from Orange County, California Category:Living people
title: Brian Tyler
